class Eval.Eval(struct_solver, mass_solver, interferences_solver, boundary_conditions, properties_dict)[source]¶

blank_test(truss)[source]¶

Blank function used for testing GA when no evaluation needed

interferences_ray_tracing(truss)[source]¶
mass_basic(truss)[source]¶

Calculates mass of structure

Considers only members, does not account for additional mass due to welds or connection hardware.

Parameters:truss (Truss object) – Truss to be evaluated. Must have nodes, edges, and properties defined.
Returns:Mass of the structure in kg.
Return type:mass (float)
mat_struct_analysis_DSM(truss)[source]¶

Calculates deflections and stresses using direct stiffness method.

Constructs global stiffness matrix from nodes and connections, and computes deflections under each loading scenario. From deflections, calculates internal forces, stresses, and factor of safety in each member under each loading scenario

Parameters:truss (Truss object) – Truss to be evaluated. Must have nodes, edges, and properties defined.
Returns:
2D array of factor of safety values. First index
corresponds to members, second index corresponds to different loading scenarios. Factor of safety is defined as the materials yield strength divided by the von Mises stress in the member. If structure is statically indeterminate under a given loading scenario, FoS will be zero. FoS in member i under loading j is FoS[i, j]
V (ndarray): 3D array of node deflections. Distances in meters,
angles in radians. First index corresponds to node number, second index is deflections in x,y,z coordinates, and rotations about x,y,z axes. The third axis corresponds to different loading scenarios. Deflection at node i under loading j is V[i, :, j] = [dx, dy, dz, d_theta_x, d_theta_y, d_theta_z]
Return type:FoS (ndarray)
properties_dict = None¶
